event.name: lv_event_send

args.name: event_code
args.description: the type of the event from `lv_event_t`

args.name: param
args.description: arbitrary data depending on the widget type and the event. (Usually `NULL`)

event.returnsDescription: LV_RES_OK: `obj` was not deleted in the event; LV_RES_INV: `obj` was deleted in the event_code

event.name: lv_event_get_target
event.description: Get the object originally targeted by the event. It's the same even if the event is bubbled.

event.name: lv_event_get_current_target
event.description: Get the current target of the event. It's the object which event handler being called. If the event is not bubbled it's the same as "normal" target.
event.returnsDescription: pointer to the current target of the event_code

event.name: lv_event_get_code
event.description: Get the event code of an event

event.name: lv_event_get_param
event.description: Get the parameter passed when the event was sent

event.name: lv_event_get_user_data
event.description: Get the user_data passed when the event was registered on the object

event.name: lv_event_stop_bubbling
event.description: Stop the event from bubbling. This is only valid when called in the middle of an event processing chain.

event.name: lv_event_stop_processing
event.description: Stop processing this event. This is only valid when called in the middle of an event processing chain.

event.name: lv_event_register_id
event.description: Register a new, custom event ID. It can be used the same way as e.g. `LV_EVENT_CLICKED` to send custom events

event.name: lv_event_get_indev
event.description: Get the input device passed as parameter to indev related events.
event.returnsDescription: the indev that triggered the event or NULL if called on a not indev related event

event.name: lv_event_get_draw_part_dsc
event.description: Get the part draw descriptor passed as parameter to `LV_EVENT_DRAW_PART_BEGIN/END`.
event.returnsDescription: the part draw descriptor to hook the drawing or NULL if called on an unrelated event

event.name: lv_event_get_draw_ctx
event.description: Get the draw context which should be the first parameter of the draw functions. Namely: `LV_EVENT_DRAW_MAIN/POST`, `LV_EVENT_DRAW_MAIN/POST_BEGIN`, `LV_EVENT_DRAW_MAIN/POST_END`
event.returnsDescription: pointer to a draw context or NULL if called on an unrelated event

event.name: lv_event_get_old_size
event.description: Get the old area of the object before its size was changed. Can be used in `LV_EVENT_SIZE_CHANGED`
event.returnsDescription: the old absolute area of the object or NULL if called on an unrelated event

event.name: lv_event_get_key
event.description: Get the key passed as parameter to an event. Can be used in `LV_EVENT_KEY`
event.returnsDescription: the triggering key or NULL if called on an unrelated event

event.name: lv_event_get_scroll_anim
event.description: Get the animation descriptor of a scrolling. Can be used in `LV_EVENT_SCROLL_BEGIN`
event.returnsDescription: the animation that will scroll the object. (can be modified as required)

event.name: lv_event_set_ext_draw_size
event.description: Set the new extra draw size. Can be used in `LV_EVENT_REFR_EXT_DRAW_SIZE`

event.name: lv_event_get_self_size_info
event.description: Get a pointer to an `lv_point_t` variable in which the self size should be saved (width in `point->x` and height `point->y`). Can be used in `LV_EVENT_GET_SELF_SIZE`
event.returnsDescription: pointer to `lv_point_t` or NULL if called on an unrelated event

event.name: lv_event_get_hit_test_info
event.description: Get a pointer to an `lv_hit_test_info_t` variable in which the hit test result should be saved. Can be used in `LV_EVENT_HIT_TEST`
event.returnsDescription: pointer to `lv_hit_test_info_t` or NULL if called on an unrelated event

event.name: lv_event_get_cover_area
event.description: Get a pointer to an area which should be examined whether the object fully covers it or not. Can be used in `LV_EVENT_HIT_TEST`
event.returnsDescription: an area with absolute coordinates to check

event.name: lv_event_set_cover_res
event.description: Set the result of cover checking. Can be used in `LV_EVENT_COVER_CHECK`

color.description: The floating point math for conversion is: valueto = valuefrom * ( (2^bitsto - 1) / (float)(2^bitsfrom - 1) ) The faster integer math for conversion is: valueto = ( valuefrom * multiplier + adder ) >> divisor multiplier = FLOOR( ( (2^bitsto - 1) << divisor ) / (float)(2^bitsfrom - 1) ) Find the first divisor where ( adder >> divisor ) <= 0 5-bit to 8-bit: ( 31 * multiplier + adder ) >> divisor = 255 divisor  multiplier  adder  min (0)  max (31) 0           8      7        7       255 1          16     14        7       255 2          32     28        7       255 3          65     25        3       255 4         131     19        1       255 5         263      7        0       255 6-bit to 8-bit: 255 = ( 63 * multiplier + adder ) >> divisor divisor  multiplier  adder  min (0)  max (63) 0           4      3        3       255 1           8      6        3       255 2          16     12        3       255 3          32     24        3       255 4          64     48        3       255 5         129     33        1       255 6         259      3        0       255 / lv_color32_t ret; LV_COLOR_SET_R32(ret, (LV_COLOR_GET_R(color) * 263 + 7) >> 5); LV_COLOR_SET_G32(ret, (LV_COLOR_GET_G(color) * 259 + 3) >> 6); LV_COLOR_SET_B32(ret, (LV_COLOR_GET_B(color) * 263 + 7) >> 5); LV_COLOR_SET_A32(ret, 0xFF); return ret.full; #elif LV_COLOR_DEPTH == 32 return color.full; #endif } //! @cond Doxygen_Suppress /** Mix two colors with a given ratio.
color.returnsDescription: the given RGB color in RGB (with LV_COLOR_DEPTH depth)

textarea.description: ******************* TYPEDEFS *********************/ /*Data of text area*/ typedef struct { lv_obj_t obj; lv_obj_t * label;            /*Label of the text area*/ char * placeholder_txt;      /*Place holder label. only visible if text is an empty string*/ char * pwd_tmp;              /*Used to store the original text in password mode*/ char * pwd_bullet;           /*Replacement characters displayed in password mode*/ const char * accepted_chars; /*Only these characters will be accepted. NULL: accept all*/ uint32_t max_length;         /*The max. number of characters. 0: no limit*/ uint16_t pwd_show_time;      /*Time to show characters in password mode before change them to '*'*/ struct { lv_coord_t valid_x;        /*Used when stepping up/down to a shorter line. (Used by the library)*/ uint32_t pos;              /*The current cursor position (0: before 1st letter; 1: before 2nd letter ...)*/ lv_area_t area;            /*Cursor area relative to the Text Area*/ uint32_t txt_byte_pos;     /*Byte index of the letter after (on) the cursor*/ uint8_t show : 1;          /*Cursor is visible now or not (Handled by the library)*/ uint8_t click_pos : 1;     /*1: Enable positioning the cursor by clicking the text area*/ } cursor; #if LV_LABEL_TEXT_SELECTION uint32_t sel_start;  /*Temporary values for text selection*/ uint32_t sel_end; uint8_t text_sel_in_prog : 1; /*User is in process of selecting*/ uint8_t text_sel_en : 1;      /*Text can be selected on this text area*/ #endif uint8_t pwd_mode : 1; /*Replace characters with '*'*/ uint8_t one_line : 1; /*One line mode (ignore line breaks)*/ } lv_textarea_t; extern const lv_obj_class_t lv_textarea_class; enum { LV_PART_TEXTAREA_PLACEHOLDER = LV_PART_CUSTOM_FIRST, }; /********************** GLOBAL PROTOTYPES *********************/ /** Create a text area object

items.name: LV_EVENT_PRESSED
items.description: The object has been pressed

items.name: LV_EVENT_PRESSING
items.description: The object is being pressed (called continuously while pressing)

items.name: LV_EVENT_PRESS_LOST
items.description: The object is still being pressed but slid cursor/finger off of the object

items.name: LV_EVENT_SHORT_CLICKED
items.description: The object was pressed for a short period of time, then released it. Not called if scrolled.

items.name: LV_EVENT_LONG_PRESSED
items.description: Object has been pressed for at least `long_press_time`.  Not called if scrolled.

items.name: LV_EVENT_LONG_PRESSED_REPEAT
items.description: Called after `long_press_time` in every `long_press_repeat_time` ms.  Not called if scrolled.

items.name: LV_EVENT_CLICKED
items.description: Called on release if not scrolled (regardless to long press)

items.name: LV_EVENT_RELEASED
items.description: Called in every cases when the object has been released

items.name: LV_EVENT_SCROLL_BEGIN
items.description: Scrolling begins. The event parameter is a pointer to the animation of the scroll. Can be modified

items.name: LV_EVENT_SCROLL_END
items.description: Scrolling ends

items.name: LV_EVENT_SCROLL
items.description: Scrolling

items.name: LV_EVENT_GESTURE
items.description: A gesture is detected. Get the gesture with `lv_indev_get_gesture_dir(lv_indev_get_act());`

items.name: LV_EVENT_KEY
items.description: A key is sent to the object. Get the key with `lv_indev_get_key(lv_indev_get_act());`

items.name: LV_EVENT_FOCUSED
items.description: The object is focused

items.name: LV_EVENT_DEFOCUSED
items.description: The object is defocused

items.name: LV_EVENT_LEAVE
items.description: The object is defocused but still selected

items.name: LV_EVENT_HIT_TEST
items.description: Perform advanced hit-testing

items.name: LV_EVENT_COVER_CHECK
items.description: Check if the object fully covers an area. The event parameter is `lv_cover_check_info_t *`.

items.name: LV_EVENT_REFR_EXT_DRAW_SIZE
items.description: Get the required extra draw area around the object (e.g. for shadow). The event parameter is `lv_coord_t *` to store the size.

items.name: LV_EVENT_DRAW_MAIN_BEGIN
items.description: Starting the main drawing phase

items.name: LV_EVENT_DRAW_MAIN
items.description: Perform the main drawing

items.name: LV_EVENT_DRAW_MAIN_END
items.description: Finishing the main drawing phase

items.name: LV_EVENT_DRAW_POST_BEGIN
items.description: Starting the post draw phase (when all children are drawn)

items.name: LV_EVENT_DRAW_POST
items.description: Perform the post draw phase (when all children are drawn)

items.name: LV_EVENT_DRAW_POST_END
